stack.q: What tech stack do you use?
stack.a: Go for high-performance backend services and APIs; Nuxt/Vue for frontend; Postgres/Mongo for data; deployed on Vercel.

time.q: How long does a typical website project take?
time.a: A marketing/portfolio site takes 1–2 weeks. If we include custom integrations or headless CMS, budget 2–4 weeks depending on scope.

backend.q: Do you handle both backend and frontend?
backend.a: Yes. I design and build the backend (Go APIs, auth, performance) and the frontend (Nuxt/Vue, UI/UX)

fractional.q: Can you join as a fractional engineer?
fractional.a: I am currently working full-time, so my availability for fractional roles is limited. However, I am open to discussing specific consulting opportunities.

timezone.q: Which time zones do you work with?
timezone.a: I collaborate mostly with US and LATAM teams and can overlap 4–6 hours with US time zones for standups and reviews.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Quick answers about my process, timelines, and how we can work together.

time.a: Typically 10 business days for the first version, then iterating until you are satisfied with the result.

texts.q: Do I need to have the texts ready?
texts.a: Don't worry. I include a structure and copywriting guide. We work together to extract your value proposition and I give it a commercial form.

changes.q: What happens if I want to make changes later?
changes.a: If you need structural changes, design changes, or new sections after delivery, they will be quoted separately. The monthly maintenance ($20 USD) covers technical support so the site is always online and secure, but does not include development of new features.

hosting.q: Does it include hosting and domain?
hosting.a: The service includes hosting on high-speed servers. The domain (yourcompany.com) and any third-party paid tools (like Calendly Premium, Email Marketing, etc.) must be purchased by you; I advise you on the process, but payment is your responsibility.
